sluce2.landscape
Class LandscapeContext

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<T>
      repast.simphony.context.AbstractContext<T>
          repast.simphony.context.SmallDefaultContext<T>
              repast.simphony.context.DefaultContext<Cell>
                  sluce2.landscape.LandscapeContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<Cell>, java.util.Collection<Cell>, repast.simphony.context.Context<Cell>, repast.simphony.context.ContextListener, repast.simphony.context.RepastElement
public class LandscapeContext
extends repast.simphony.context.DefaultContext<Cell>

The LandscapeContext encapsulates the current landscape of the model.

The LandscapeContext maintains an internal RasterRepository representing the current landscape. The landscape is constructed from a landscape descriptor xml file. See: umn.geog.helia. Methods are included in the LandscapeContext to access and manipulate the internal landscape, ensuring encapsulation of the internal RasterRepository within the LandscapeContext.

The LandscapeContext also creates the visual grid that displays when the model runs in GUI mode.

There is only one instance of the LandscapeContext at all times.

Author:
Meghan Hutchins

LandscapeContext

private LandscapeContext(java.lang.String pathToLandscapeDescriptor)
Creates and initializes a new LandscapeContext using the given Landscape Descriptor

The landscape descriptor is an XML file that Helia uses to load raster files into the Java program.

Parameters:
full - path to the landscape descriptor XML

putValue

public boolean putValue(java.lang.String layerName,
                        Coord loc,
                        java.lang.Number newValue)
This method does not write the new value to the raster layer, it only saves the value in memory. To write the new value permanently to the raster layer, execute the updateLandscape method in this class.

Returns:
true if the new value was put in the layer and the specified location, false otherwise

saveLandscape

public boolean saveLandscape()
This method writes over the current landscape value.

Returns:
true if landscape has been updated, false otherwise

archiveLayer

public boolean archiveLayer(java.lang.String layername)
This method does not write over the current landscape value, but saves the layer to a new file in the folder indicated by the LANDSCAPE_ARCHIVE_DIRECTORY in the GlobalConstants class.

Parameters:
layername -
Returns:
true if layer has been archived, false otherwise
